Package us.daveread.edu.sound

Class PlaySound

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.daveread.edu.sound.PlaySound
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.sound.sampled.LineListener
    public class PlaySound
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.sound.sampled.LineListener, java.lang.Runnable
    Plays a sound. Only one sound may be played at a time.
    Version:
    01.00.00
    Author:
    readda

      • playSound

        public void playSound​(SoundFile sound)
        Play a sound once. If a sound is currently playing, it will be interrupted.
        Parameters:

        Stop current sound

      • isSoundPlaying

        public boolean isSoundPlaying()
        Determine whether a sound is currently playing
        Returns:
        True if a sound is playing

      • playSound

        public void playSound​(SoundFile sound,
                      boolean loop)
        Play a sound either once or loop repeatedly. If a sound is currently playing, it will be interrupted.
        Parameters:
        sound - The sound to play
        loop - Whether to loop the sound indefinitely

      • playSound

        public void playSound​(SoundFile sound,
                      boolean loop,
                      int maxTtlSeconds)
        Play a sound either once or loop repeatedly. If a sound is currently playing, it will be interrupted.
        Parameters:
        sound - The sound to play
        loop - Whether to loop the sound indefinitely
        maxTtlSeconds - Maximum seconds before sound is automatically stopped if it hasn't ended

      • playSound

        public void playSound​(SoundFile sound,
                      boolean loop,
                      float dbAdjust)
        Play a sound either once or loop repeatedly. If a sound is currently playing, it will be interrupted.
        Parameters:
        sound - The sound to play
        loop - Whether to loop the sound indefinitely
        dbAdjust - Alter the volume of the sound being played. Setting is in decibels and may range from -80 to +6. If an invalid value is supplied, the volume setting will be ignored and left at 0db

      • playSound

        public void playSound​(SoundFile sound,
                      boolean loop,
                      float dbAdjust,
                      int maxTtlSeconds)
        Play a sound either once or loop repeatedly. If a sound is currently playing, it will be interrupted.
        Parameters:
        sound - The sound to play
        loop - Whether to loop the sound indefinitely
        dbAdjust - Alter the volume of the sound being played. Setting is in decibels and may range from -80 to +6. If an invalid value is supplied, the volume setting will be ignored and left at 0db
        maxTtlSeconds - Maximum seconds before sound is automatically stopped if it hasn't ended

      • cancelCurrentSound

        private void cancelCurrentSound()
        If a sound is currently playing, stop it by interrupting the thread

      • setupAndPlayClip

        public void setupAndPlayClip​(boolean loop,
                             float volumeAdjustment)
        Load the currently configured sound and start playing it.
        Parameters:
        loop - Whether the sound is to loop continuously. If true the sound will loop until canceled other wise it will play once.
        volumeAdjustment - Alter the volume of the sound being played. Setting is in decibels.

      • loadSoundFromClasspath

        private javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream loadSoundFromClasspath​(java.lang.String filePath)

      • setMaxTtl

        private void setMaxTtl​(long milliseconds)
        Maximum time allotted for the sound to keep playing. The sound will stop when the time expires unless it stopped for another reason such as reaching the end of the clip. A value of 0 indicates the sound should keep playing until it ends or is interrupted by another clip
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - Maximum time sound should keep playing. 0 indicates it will be play until it ends or is interrupted separately.

      • handleLineEvent

        private void handleLineEvent​(javax.sound.sampled.LineEvent event)
        Notify listeners of meaningful state changes. Currently only the stop event is passed on to listeners.
        Parameters:
        event - The sound event

      • addListener

        public void addListener​(java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
        Add a listener interested in sound state changes
        Parameters:
        listener - A listener to be notified of sound state changes

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener​(java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
        Remove a listener no longer interested in sound state changes. No error occurs if the listener is not currently registered.
        Parameters:
        listener - A listener to be removed from future sound state change notifications
